lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But as the dollar slid against the mark and world stock and bond markets plunged, officials in the major industrial countries played down the dispute as a bilateral problem between the United States and West Germany and insisted that the currency pact was still alive.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Under the Louvre Accord West Germany and Japan, who both have large trade surpluses, pledged to boost their economic growth to take in more exports from the U.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: S. Frustration over higher interest rates abroad, "this does not represent its readiness to scrap the basic framework of the Louvre Accord."
